title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Submit issue Issues page

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Fork repo Github account Clone version account machine account, e.g,. git clone https://github.com/<yourgithubusername>/ckanr.git Make sure track progress upstream (.e., version ckanr ropensci/ckanr) git remote add upstream https://github.com/ropensci/ckanr.git. making changes make sure pull changes upstream either git fetch upstream merge later git pull upstream fetch merge one step Make changes (bonus points making changes new feature branch) Test changes locally. need Docker Compose (installation instructions available https://docs.docker.com/compose/install/). can spin local CKAN site Enter http://localhost:5000/ browser see CKAN running. sysadmin user created default username=ckan_admin password=test1234. can retrieve user details including API KEY (R environment variable TEST_API_KEY) Push account Submit pull request home base (likely master branch, check make sure) ropensci/ckanr
code: CKAN_VERSION=2.8 docker compose up docker exec ckan paster --plugin=ckan user ckan_admin

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Don’t send email. Open issue instead.

title: ckanr vignette
text: Stable version CRAN Development version GitHub Note: default base CKAN URL set http://data.techno-science.ca/. can change using ckanr_setup(), change URL using url parameter function call. set one , run:
code: install.packages("ckanr") remotes::install_github("ropensci/ckanr") library("ckanr") # restores default CKAN url to http://data.techno-science.ca/ ckanr_setup()  # Just set url ckanr_setup(url = "http://data.techno-science.ca/") # set url and key ckanr_setup(url = "http://data.techno-science.ca/", key = "my-ckan-api-key")

title: ckanr vignette
text: ckanr implements dplyr SQL interface CKAN’s datastore. can access resource datastore directly using CKAN resource ID. Note: work resources uploaded successfully datastore - show green “Data API” button CKAN.
code: ckan <- ckanr::src_ckan("https://my.ckan.org/") res_id <- "my-ckan-resource-id" dplyr::tbl(src = ckan$con, from = res_id) %>% as_tibble(.)

title: Client for the Comprehensive Knowledge Archive Network (CKAN) API
text: ckanr R client CKAN API.

title: Client for the Comprehensive Knowledge Archive Network (CKAN) API
text: CKAN open source set tools hosting providing data web. (CKAN users include non-profits, museums, local city/county governments, etc.). ckanr allows users interact CKAN websites create, modify, manage datasets, well search download pre-existing data, proceed using R data analysis (stats/plotting/etc.). meant general possible, allowing work CKAN instance. Get started: https://docs.ropensci.org/ckanr/

title: Client for the Comprehensive Knowledge Archive Network (CKAN) API
text: Stable CRAN version Development version Note: default base CKAN URL set https://data.ontario.ca/ Functions requiring write permissions CKAN additionally require privileged CKAN API key. can change using ckanr_setup(), change URL using url parameter function call. set one , run:
code: install.packages("ckanr") install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("ropensci/ckanr") library('ckanr') ckanr_setup() # restores default CKAN url to https://data.ontario.ca/ ckanr_setup(url = "https://data.ontario.ca/") ckanr_setup(url = "https://data.ontario.ca/", key = "my-ckan-api-key")

title: Client for the Comprehensive Knowledge Archive Network (CKAN) API
text: suite CKAN things (package, resource, etc.) set functions package. functions CKAN thing S3 class returned functions, can passed functions (also facilitates piping). following list function groups certain CKAN things, prefix functions work thing, name S3 class: Packages (aka packages) - package_*() - ckan_package Resources - resource_*() - ckan_resource Related - related_*() - ckan_related Users - user_*() - ckan_user Groups - group_*() - ckan_group Tags - tag_*() - ckan_tag Organizations - organization_*() - ckan_organization Groups - group_*() - ckan_group Users - user_*() - ckan_user Related items - related_*() - ckan_related S3 class objects look similar; example: classes state type object, ID right type, varying set key-value fields deemed important. printed object just summary R list, can index specific values (e.g., result$description). feel important fields left printed summaries, let us know. note: Many examples given brief readme brevity
code: <CKAN Resource> 8abc92ad-7379-4fb8-bba0-549f38a26ddb   Name: Data From Digital Portal   Description:   Creator/Modified: 2015-08-18T19:20:59.732601 / 2015-08-18T19:20:59.657943   Size:   Format: CSV

title: Get an activity stream of recently changed datasets on a site. — changes
text: offset (numeric) start getting activity items (optional, default: 0) limit (numeric) maximum number activities return (optional, default: 31) url Base url use. Default: https://data.ontario.ca/ See also ckanr_setup get_default_url. key privileged CKAN API key, Default: key set ckanr_setup (character) One list (default), table, json. Parsing table option uses jsonlite::fromJSON(..., simplifyDataFrame = TRUE), attempts parse data data.frame's possible, result can vary vector, list data.frame. (required) ... Curl args passed verb-POST (optional)

title: Get an activity stream of recently changed datasets on a site. — changes
code: if (FALSE) { changes() changes(as = 'json') changes(as = 'table') }

title: Download a file — ckan_fetch
text: x URL file store One session (default) disk. session stores R session, disk saves file disk. path store="disk", must give path store file format Format file. Required format detectable file URL. key CKAN API key (optional, character) ... Arguments passed function used read file, store="session". See details.

title: Download a file — ckan_fetch
text: ... argument can used pass additional arguments function actually reads file. used store="session" file ZIP file. list shows function used read file format, can see additional arguments available: csv: read.csv xls, xlsx: read_excel xml: read_xml html: read_html json: fromJSON shp, geojson: st_read txt: read.table

title: Download a file — ckan_fetch
code: if (FALSE) { # CSV file ckanr_setup("http://datamx.io") res <- resource_show(id = "6145a539-cbde-4b0d-a3d3-d1a5eb013f5c", as = "table") head(ckan_fetch(res$url)) ckan_fetch(res$url, "disk", "myfile.csv")  # CSV file, format not available ckanr_setup("https://ckan0.cf.opendata.inter.prod-toronto.ca") res <- resource_show(id = "c57c3e1c-20e2-470f-bc82-e39a0264be31", as = "table") res$url res$format head(ckan_fetch(res$url, format = res$format))  # Excel file - requires readxl package ckanr_setup("http://datamx.io") res <- resource_show(id = "e883510e-a082-435c-872a-c5b915857ae1", as = "table") head(ckan_fetch(res$url))  # Excel file, multiple sheets - requires readxl package ckanr_setup() res <- resource_show(id = "ce02a1cf-35f1-41df-91d9-11ed1fdd4186", as = "table") x <- ckan_fetch(res$url) names(x) head(x[["Mayor - Maire"]])  # XML file - requires xml2 package # ckanr_setup("http://data.ottawa.ca") # res <- resource_show(id = "380061c1-6c46-4da6-a01b-7ab0f49a881e", # as = "table") # ckan_fetch(res$url)  # HTML file - requires xml2 package ckanr_setup("http://open.canada.ca/data/en") res <- resource_show(id = "80321bac-4283-487c-93bd-c65acaa660f5", as = "table") ckan_fetch(res$url) library("xml2") xml_text(xml_find_first(xml_children(ckan_fetch(res$url))[[1]], "title"))  # JSON file, by default reads in to a data.frame for ease of use ckanr_setup("http://data.surrey.ca") res <- resource_show(id = "8d07c662-800d-4977-9e3e-5a3d2d1e99ab", as = "table") head(ckan_fetch(res$url))  # SHP file (spatial data, ESRI format) - requires sf package ckanr_setup("https://ckan0.cf.opendata.inter.prod-toronto.ca") res <- resource_show(id = "27362290-8bbf-434b-a9de-325a6c2ef923", as = "table") x <- ckan_fetch(res$url) class(x) plot(x[, c("AREA_NAME", "geometry")])  # GeoJSON file - requires sf package ckanr_setup("http://datamx.io") res <- resource_show(id = "b1cd35b7-479e-4fa0-86e9-e897d3c617e6", as = "table") x <- ckan_fetch(res$url) class(x) plot(x[, c("mun_name", "geometry")])  # ZIP file - packages required depends on contents ckanr_setup("https://ckan0.cf.opendata.inter.prod-toronto.ca") res <- resource_show(id = "bb21e1b8-a466-41c6-8bc3-3c362cb1ed55", as = "table") x <- ckan_fetch(res$url) names(x) head(x[["ChickenpoxAgegroups2017.csv"]])  # TXT file ckanr_setup("https://ckan0.cf.opendata.inter.prod-toronto.ca") res <- resource_show(id = "e4211f49-611f-438c-a444-aaa7f3f84117", as = "table") x <- ckan_fetch(res$url) head(x)  # TXT file, semicolon used as separator ckanr_setup("https://data.coat.no") res <- resource_show(id = "384fe537-e0bd-4e57-8a0d-420b7a745196", as = "table") x <- ckan_fetch(res$url, sep = ";") head(x) }

title: Configure default CKAN settings — ckanr_setup
text: url CKAN URL (optional), default: https://data.ontario.ca key CKAN API key (optional, character) test_url (optional, character) valid CKAN URL testing purposes test_key (optional, character) valid CKAN API key privileged create datasets test_url test_did (optional, character) valid CKAN dataset ID, existing test_url test_rid (optional, character) valid CKAN resource ID, attached test_gid (optional, character) valid CKAN group name test_url test_oid (optional, character) valid CKAN organization name test_url test_behaviour (optional, character) Whether fail ("FAIL") skip ("SKIP") writing tests case problems configured test CKAN. proxy object class request call crul::proxy()

title: Configure default CKAN settings — ckanr_setup
text: ckanr_setup() sets CKAN connection details. ckanr's functions default use default URL API key unless specified explicitly. ckanr's automated tests require valid CKAN URL, privileged API key URL, plus IDs existing dataset existing resource, respectively. writing tests (create, update, delete) can fail two reasons: failures ckanr's code tests aim detect, failures configured CKAN, necessarily problem ckanr's code prevent tests prove otherwise. Setting test_behaviour "SKIP" allow writing tests skip configured test CKAN fails. desirable e.g. test functions even tester write access CKAN instance. Setting test_behaviour "FAIL" let tester find problems configured test CKAN writing functions.

title: Configure default CKAN settings — ckanr_setup
code: # CKAN users without admin/editor privileges could run: ckanr_setup(url = "https://data.ontario.ca/")  # Privileged CKAN editor/admin users can run: ckanr_setup(url = "https://data.ontario.ca/", key = "some-CKAN-API-key")  # ckanR developers/testers can run: ckanr_setup(url = "https://data.ontario.ca/", key = "some-CKAN-API-key",            test_url = "http://test-ckan.gov/",test_key = "test-ckan-API-key",            test_did = "test-ckan-dataset-id",test_rid = "test-ckan-resource-id",            test_gid = "test-group-name", test_oid = "test-organzation-name",            test_behaviour = "FAIL")  # Not specifying the default CKAN URL will reset the CKAN URL to its default # "https://data.ontario.ca/": ckanr_setup()  # set a proxy ckanr_setup(proxy = crul::proxy("64.251.21.73:8080")) ckanr_settings() #> <ckanr settings> #>   Base URL:  https://data.ontario.ca/  #>   API key:  some-CKAN-API-key  #>   Test CKAN URL: http://test-ckan.gov/  #>   Test CKAN API key: test-ckan-API-key  #>   Test CKAN dataset ID: test-ckan-dataset-id  #>   Test CKAN resource ID: test-ckan-resource-id  #>   Test CKAN group ID: test-group-name  #>   Test CKAN organization ID: test-organzation-name  #>   Test behaviour if CKAN offline: FAIL  #>   Proxy:  ## run without setting proxy to reset to no proxy ckanr_setup() ckanr_settings() #> <ckanr settings> #>   Base URL:  https://data.ontario.ca/  #>   API key:  some-CKAN-API-key  #>   Test CKAN URL: http://test-ckan.gov/  #>   Test CKAN API key: test-ckan-API-key  #>   Test CKAN dataset ID: test-ckan-dataset-id  #>   Test CKAN resource ID: test-ckan-resource-id  #>   Test CKAN group ID: test-group-name  #>   Test CKAN organization ID: test-organzation-name  #>   Test behaviour if CKAN offline: FAIL  #>   Proxy:

title: Create a package — package_create
text: name (character) name new dataset, must 2 100 characters long contain lowercase alphanumeric characters, - _, e.g. 'warandpeace' title (character) title dataset (optional, default: name) private (logical) whether dataset private (optional, default: FALSE), requires value owner_org TRUE author (character) name dataset's author (optional) author_email (character) email address dataset's author (optional) maintainer (character) name dataset's maintainer (optional) maintainer_email (character) email address dataset's maintainer (optional) license_id (license id string) - id dataset's license, see license_list() available values (optional) notes (character) description dataset (optional) package_url (character) URL dataset's source (optional) version (string, longer 100 characters) - (optional) state (character) current state dataset, e.g. 'active' 'deleted', active datasets show search results lists datasets, parameter ignored authorized change state dataset (optional, default: 'active') type (character) type dataset (optional), IDatasetForm plugins associate different dataset types provide custom dataset handling behaviour types resources (list resource dictionaries) - dataset's resources, see resource_create() format resource dictionaries (optional) tags (list tag dictionaries) - dataset's tags, see tag_create() format tag dictionaries (optional) extras (list dataset extra dictionaries) - dataset's extras (optional), extras arbitrary (key: value) metadata items can added datasets, extra dictionary keys 'key' (string), 'value' (string) relationships_as_object (list relationship dictionaries) - see package_relationship_create format relationship dictionaries (optional) relationships_as_subject (list relationship dictionaries) - see package_relationship_create format relationship dictionaries (optional) groups (data.frame) groups dataset belongs, row one following columns identify existing group: 'id' (id group, string), 'name' (name group, string), see groups exist call group_list(). see example (optional) owner_org (character) id dataset's owning organization, see organization_list() organization_list_for_user available values (optional) url Base url use. Default: https://data.ontario.ca/ See also ckanr_setup get_default_url. key privileged CKAN API key, Default: key set ckanr_setup (character) One list (default), table, json. Parsing table option uses jsonlite::fromJSON(..., simplifyDataFrame = TRUE), attempts parse data data.frame's possible, result can vary vector, list data.frame. (required) ... Curl args passed verb-POST (optional)

title: Search for packages. — package_search
code: package_search(   q = "*:*",   fq = NULL,   sort = NULL,   rows = NULL,   start = NULL,   facet = FALSE,   facet.limit = NULL,   facet.field = NULL,   facet.mincount = NULL,   include_drafts = FALSE,   include_private = FALSE,   use_default_schema = FALSE,   url = get_default_url(),   key = get_default_key(),   as = "list",   ... )

title: Search for packages. — package_search
text: q Query terms, defaults ':', everything. fq Filter query, affect search, gets returned sort Field sort . can specify ascending (e.g., score desc) descending (e.g., score asc), sort two fields (e.g., score desc, price asc), sort function (e.g., sum(x_f, y_f) desc, sorts sum x_f y_f descending order). rows Number records return. Defaults 10. start Record start , default beginning. facet (logical) Whether return facet results . Default: FALSE facet.limit (numeric) param indicates maximum number constraint counts returned facet fields. negative value means unlimited. Default: 100. Can specified per field basis. facet.field (character) param allows specify field treated facet. iterate Term field generate facet count using Term constraint. parameter can specified multiple times indicate multiple facet fields. None params section effect without specifying least one field name using param. facet.mincount (integer) minimum counts facet fields included results include_drafts (logical) TRUE draft datasets included. user returned draft datasets, sysadmin returned draft datasets. default: FALSE. first CKAN version: 2.6.1; dropped request CKAN version older CKAN version available via ckan_version() include_private (logical) TRUE private datasets included. private datasets user’s organizations returned sysadmins returned private datasets. default: FALSE first CKAN version: 2.6.1; dropped request CKAN version older CKAN version available via ckan_version() use_default_schema (logical) use default package schema instead custom schema defined IDatasetForm plugin. default: FALSE first CKAN version: 2.3.5; dropped request CKAN version older CKAN version available via ckan_version() url Base url use. Default: https://data.ontario.ca/ See also ckanr_setup get_default_url. key privileged CKAN API key, Default: key set ckanr_setup (character) One list (default), table, json. Parsing table option uses jsonlite::fromJSON(..., simplifyDataFrame = TRUE), attempts parse data data.frame's possible, result can vary vector, list data.frame. (required) ... Curl args passed verb-POST (optional)

title: Update a resource — resource_update
text: http://docs.ckan.org/en/latest/api/index.html#ckan.logic.action.create.resource_create

title: Update a resource — resource_update
code: if (FALSE) { ckanr_setup(url = "https://demo.ckan.org/", key = getOption("ckan_demo_key"))  # Get file path <- system.file("examples", "actinidiaceae.csv", package = "ckanr")  # Create package, then a resource within that package (res <- package_create("newpackage10")) (xx <- resource_create(package_id = res$id,                        description = "my resource",                        name = "bears",                        upload = path,                        rcurl = "http://google.com" ))  # Modify dataset, here lowercase strings in one column dat <- read.csv(path, stringsAsFactors = FALSE) dat$Family <- tolower(dat$Family) newpath <- tempfile(fileext = ".csv") write.csv(dat, file = newpath, row.names = FALSE)  # Upload modified dataset ## Directly from output of resource_create resource_update(xx, path=newpath)  ## or from the resource id resource_update(xx$id, path=newpath)  ## optionally include extra tags resource_update(xx$id, path=newpath,                 extras = list(some="metadata"))                  # Update a resource's extra tags ## add extra tags without uploading a new file resource_update(id,                 extras = list(some="metadata"))  ## or remove all extra tags resource_update(id, extras = list())                   ####### # Using default settings ckanr_setup(url = "http://demo.ckan.org/", key = "my-demo-ckan-org-api-key") path <- system.file("examples", "actinidiaceae.csv", package = "ckanr") resource_update(id="an-existing-resource-id", path = path)  # Using an R object written to a tempfile, and implicit CKAN URL and API key write.csv(data <- installed.packages(), path <- tempfile(fileext = ".csv")) ckanr_setup(url = "http://demo.ckan.org/", key = "my-demo-ckan-org-api-key") resource_update(id="an-existing-resource-id", path = path)  # Testing: see ?ckanr_setup to set default test CKAN url, key, package id ckanr_setup(test_url = "http://my-ckan.org/",             test_key = "my-ckan-api-key",             test_did = "an-existing-package-id",             test_rid = "an-existing-resource-id") resource_update(id = get_test_rid(),                 path = system.file("examples",                                    "actinidiaceae.csv",                                    package = "ckanr"),                 key = get_test_key(),                 url = get_test_url())  # other file formats ## html path <- system.file("examples", "mapbox.html", package = "ckanr")  # Create package, then a resource within that package (res <- package_create("mappkg")) (xx <- resource_create(package_id = res$id,                        description = "a map, yay",                        name = "mapyay",                        upload = path,                        rcurl = "http://google.com" )) browseURL(xx$url)  # Modify dataset, here lowercase strings in one column dat <- readLines(path) dat <- sub("-111.06", "-115.06", dat) newpath <- tempfile(fileext = ".html") cat(dat, file = newpath, sep = "\n")  # Upload modified dataset ## Directly from output of resource_create (xxx <- resource_update(xx, path=newpath)) browseURL(xxx$url) }

title: ckanr 0.7.0
text: CRAN release: 2023-03-17

title: ckanr 0.7.0
text: resource_update() allows update resource extra fields making path parameter optional (#175) thanks @nicholsn

title: ckanr 0.7.0
text: revision_list package_revision_list return NULL instead error CKAN 2.9+ (#200) fix notes warnings CRAN package check results (#195)

title: ckanr 0.6.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-02-03

title: ckanr 0.6.0
text: parameter http_method gained resource_create(), package_update(), package_patch(); ’s passed .ckan_package() internally, affect HTTP request main point function (#163) thanks @hannaboe gains new function organization_purge() purge organization (requires sysadmin) (#166) thanks @nicholsn

title: ckanr 0.6.0
text: update URLs known CKAN instances behind servers() function (#162) (#167) (#170) .Rbuildignore README.md vignettes (#171) extras now passed HTTP request package_create() top level part request body rather named extras element (#158) thanks @galaH change ckan_fetch(): now zip file subdirectory NA returned rather character(0) (#164) change ... parameter ckan_fetch(): used pass curl options http request now used pass additional parameters either read.csv, xml2::read_xml, jsonlite::fromJSON, sf::st_read(), read.table(), readxl::read_excel (#165) updated docs package_create() group_create() - change groups parameter description explain kind input expected (#168)

title: ckanr 0.5.0
text: CRAN release: 2020-07-30

title: ckanr 0.5.0
text: package_create() gains parameter private (boolean) (#145) add support resource extras. resource_create() resource_update() gain new parameter extras, resource_patch() function doesn’t change gains example adding extra (#149) (#150) thanks @nicholsn package_patch() gains extras parameter (#94) see also (#147)

title: ckanr 0.5.0
text: replace httr crul throughout package (#86) (#151) use markdown docs (#148) package_patch(), package_show(), package_activity_list(), package_delete(), package_update(), related_create() now pass key parameter value .ckan_package internally; resource_create() resource_show(), passed .ckan_resource() (#145) (#146) servers() gains two additional CKAN urls (#155) package_show() called .ckan_package() within , calls package_show() - fixed now (#127)

title: ckanr 0.5.0
text: fix resource_search() tag_search: allowing query length 1 (#153) fix print.ckan_package: wasn’t handling well results package_search() named list locale specific results (#152)

title: ckanr 0.4.0
text: CRAN release: 2019-10-11

title: ckanr 0.4.0
text: ckan_fetch() gains parameter key CKAN API key; given API key now included request headers (#133) see also (#122) @sharlagelfand ckan_fetch() gains ability read xls/xlsx files multiple sheets (#135) @sharlagelfand

title: ckanr 0.4.0
text: ckan_fetch() now sets stringsAsFactors = FALSE reading data (#141) (#142) thanks @LVG77 @sharlagelfand ckan_fetch(), use basename(x) instead gsub(paste0(tempdir(), "/"), "", x), get file path (#140) @sharlagelfand package_search() handle better cases CKAN version can determined (#139) && fix logic default_schema include_private parameters included based CKAN version (#137) @sharlagelfand improve ckan_fetch(): old behavior fxn zip files worked zip file contained shp files; works generally now, e.g., zip file containing csv file (#132) @sharlagelfand fix ckan_fetch() examples weren’t working (#134) @sharlagelfand fix parsing CKAN version numbers, new internal fxn parse_version_number() - now properly parses CKAN version numbers include patch dev versions (#136) @sharlagelfand

title: ckanr 0.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2019-07-23

title: ckanr 0.3.0
text: new package author Sharla Gelfand !!! new functions users: user_create() user_delete() (#82) package_show() gains key parameter pass API key (#97) package_search() gains new parameters: include_drafts, include_private, use_default_schema, facet.mincount (#107) function fetch() changed ckan_fetch() gains function organization_delet() delete organization (#83) gains function ckan_version() get version info CKAN instance gains methods creating CKAN remote instance dplyr backend: gains src_ckan() ’s s3 methods tbl src_tbls, sql_translate_env. addition gains S3 methods db_begin, db_explain, db_has_table, db_insert_into, db_query_fields, db_query_rows

title: ckanr 0.3.0
text: fix tests (#62) fix ds_create() properly format body json data (#85) thanks @mattfullerton tests added ckan_fetch() (#118) thanks @sharlagelfand ckan_fetch() gains format parameter user knows file format (useful file format can guessed) (#117) thanks @sharlagelfand ckan_fetch gain support handling geojson (#123) thanks @sharlagelfand ckan_fetch writing current working directory cases - fixed writing temp files cleaning (#125) (#128) (#129) thanks @sharlagelfand add USDA CKAN instance servers() function (#68) ds_create_dataset() marked deprecated; see recourse_create() instead (#80) (via #79) removed internal stop() call tag_create(): now can used, though haven’t able test function need sysadmin use (#81) ds_search(): code spacing fixes (#69) resource_update() gains examples tests (#66) CKAN API key standardization: key parameter now fxns make http requests - reordering url key params order across functions (#122) (#124) repair ORCID links DESCRIPTION file (#124) Florian

title: ckanr 0.3.0
text: fix resource_create(): upload param inappropriately required param (#75) thanks @mingbogo fixes resource_update(): date sent last_modified request body needed converted character (#96) (thanks @jasonajones73); date format needed fixing (#119) (thanks @florianm) fix ckan_fetch() - use sf instead maptools; addition ckan_fetch can now parse xlsx files addition xls files; (#114) (#115) thanks @sharlagelfand fix package_search(): route fails parameters exist CKAN instance given; internally remove parameters needed query params pinging CKAN instance version (#120)
